page.title: 01Colvend and Rockcliffe
page.content: This is a lovely,peaceful place to live. There is farmland,forest,lochs, a rocky coast and a bird reserve on Rough Island. Most of the farms are dairy farms, but there are a few beef cattle and some sheep on the rough-grazing land. The farmers grow grass for silage to feed the cows. It is very hilly and there are lots of trees,wild flowers and birds. In Rockcliffe it is so mild that palm trees can be grown. Many people who live here are retired.In the summer holiday-makers come to fish in the lochs,walk on the cliffs,play on the beaches and enjoy the beautiful scenery. There is one shop,one church,one tiny school and one large hotel. It is very quiet,but we like it here.
